C

CameraControlData - Class in at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.data
Contains one set of values for controlling the RMCSs camera rotation.
CameraControlData(int, int) - Constructor for class at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.data.CameraControlData
Constructor that ensures that the data is within its valid range of [-127;127].
If the passed arguments are outside the valid range, the corresponding attributes are set to their maximum / minimum allowed value.
cameraPitch - Static variable in class at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.network.Keywords
 
cameraYaw - Static variable in class at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.network.Keywords
 
CarApplication - Class in at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs
This is the RMCSs (Racecar-Mobility-Control-System) main class, where all needed classes are being instantiated and corresponding threads are started.
It also processes all the control-change-events (via putting an element on the CarApplication.controlChangeQueue) and updates all connections in CarApplication.connections.
A set of arguments can be entered upon start, which is processed by CarApplication.processArguments(java.lang.String[]).
CarApplication() - Constructor for class at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.CarApplication

the ID that the RMCS registers itself with on the Server.

Connection - Class in at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.connection
The Connection-class is a base-class for each and every external device that communicates with the RMCS and therefore the Raspberry-Pi.
It provides basic tools for forwarding SensorData and accessing ControlData.
Listeners are able to register themselves with the ServerConnection to get updated about sending and receiving data as well as connection updates.
Connection(long, LinkedBlockingQueue<IData>, LinkedBlockingQueue<ControlChangeQueueElement>) - Constructor for class at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.connection.Connection
A simple constructor with the minimal set of parameters to instantiate a working subclass of this class.
Sets Connection.connectionId to the current value of Connection.id and increments Connection.id.
The connections that have control over the different control-data-sets cannot be set here and need to be set after instantiation, via Connection.updateControllingDevice(ControlChangeQueueElement) or {link Connection.updateControllingDevice(long, EDataType).
Connection(long, LinkedBlockingQueue<IData>, LinkedBlockingQueue<ControlChangeQueueElement>, long, long, long) - Constructor for class at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.connection.Connection
A constructor with the maximum set of parameters to instantiate a working subclass of this class.
Sets Connection.connectionId to the current value of Connection.id and increments Connection.id.
The connections that have control over the different control-data-sets are set via their corresponding parameters.

ControlChangeQueueElement - Class in at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.connection
A simple Tuple for storing information on a LinkedBlockingQueue that is used to inform the main-thread about the change of connection in control of certain control-types.
